com.avaya.csta.device

Interface DeviceServices


  • public interface DeviceServices
    Used to obtain and release device identifiers. DeviceServices is an Avaya extension to the CSTA Specification.

    Prerequisites Before using Device Services do the following:

    1. Get access to DeviceServices through the ServiceProvider. For example: 
       DeviceServices devSvcs =
   (DeviceServices)servProv.getService(com.avaya.csta.device.DeviceServices.class.getName());

    Clean Up When you are finished using a device, do the following:

    1. If you registered the device, unregister it using RegistrationServices.
    2. If you added any listeners for that device, remove them using the appropriate removeXxxListener() methods.
    3. Release the device ID, using the releaseDeviceId method defined in this DeviceServices.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.5 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • getDeviceID

        GetDeviceIdResponse getDeviceID(GetDeviceId request)
                         throws CstaException
        Gets the deviceID that represents the device described by its extension number and the switch upon which it resides. The optional controllableByOtherSessions parameter specifies whether the deviceID can be shared by more than one session. If not specified, the deviceID will be restricted to one session.

        The device ID is returned in the GetDeviceIDResponse.

        Your code to request a device ID may look like this: 

         GetDeviceId request = new GetDeviceId();
 request.setControllableByOtherSessions(Boolean.TRUE);  // optional
 request.setSwitchIPInterface(switchIPAddress);
 request.setExtension(extension);
 GetDeviceIdResponse response = devSvcs.getDeviceID(request);
 DeviceID deviceID = response.getDevice();
        Parameters:
        request - a GetDeviceId service request that specifies the session mode, extension and switch of the device
        Returns:
        GetDeviceIdResponse the DeviceID that can be used to identify the specified device
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        ResourceBusyException - if another client has obtained the specified DeviceID and has not yet released it
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • getThirdPartyDeviceID

        GetThirdPartyDeviceIdResponse getThirdPartyDeviceID(GetThirdPartyDeviceId request)
                                             throws CstaException
        Get a device ID that can be used only for third party call control. This will not cause a virtual station to be instantiated on the connector server as happens when a GetDeviceId request is sent. A third party device ID can only be used with CallControlServices and SnapshotServices. Attempting to use a third party device ID with any other service (e.g. PhysicalDeviceServices) will fail.

        Unlike first party device IDs, any number of applications can obtain a third party device ID for the same device. There is no reason to release a third party device ID.

        Your code to request a third party device ID may look like this: 

         GetThirdPartyDeviceId request = new GetThirdPartyDeviceId();
 request.setSwitchName(switchName);
 request.setExtension(extension);
 GetThirdPartyDeviceIdResponse response = devSvcs.getThirdPartyDeviceID(request);
 DeviceID deviceID = response.getDevice();
        Parameters:
        request - GetThirdPartyDeviceId request containing a switch name and an extension number.
        Returns:
        GetThirdPartyDeviceIdResponse containing the DeviceID object.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • releaseDeviceID

        ReleaseDeviceIdResponse releaseDeviceID(ReleaseDeviceId request)
                                 throws CstaException
        Releases the deviceID and the respective memory resources associated with a DeviceID.

        Parameters:
        request - a ReleaseDeviceId service request that specifies the device to be released
        Returns:
        a ReleaseDeviceIdResponse. There is no useful information in the response.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        InvalidDeviceIDException - if a client attempts to release a DeviceID that a different client has already registered and thus the release of this client's device was forced by the other client's registration of it
        InvalidDeviceStateException - if the device is registering, registered or unregistering when releaseDevice is called. It is the user's responsibilty to unregister the device before releasing it.
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • cleanupSession

        CleanupSessionResponse cleanupSession(CleanupSession request)
                               throws CstaException
        Deprecated. 
        Releases all device IDs requested in this ServiceProvider session. Used by the CMAPI server to request a broader level clean up when the client application is no longer connected. Not recommended for use by a client application.
        Parameters:
        request - a CleanupSession request
        Returns:
        CleanupSessionResponse
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterValueException - if an invalid parameter is passed
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • transferMonitorObjects

        TransferMonitorObjectsResponse transferMonitorObjects(TransferMonitorObjects request)
                                               throws CstaException
        Transfers all the deviceIDs and their established monitors from the original session to the new session specified in the request.

        The deviceIDs and their established monitor are returned in one or more TransferMonitorObjectsEvent messages that are sent after the TransferMonitorObjectsResponse.

        This may be used by a client application to recover from an unavailable session.

        The processing of a TransferMonitorObjects request may cause event notification to be interrupted if the client application has not set up the new session to receive the original session's events. This can be achieved by retrieving the established cross reference identifiers from the TransferMonitorObjectsEvents messages. The message will contain a MonitorStartResponse for each valid monitor that is associated with a transferred device ID.

        Important side effects and recommended client application actions:

        • All the monitors for each device ID will be transferred from the original to the new session.
        • The original session will be removed at the end of the transfer.
        • The client application must set up the new session to receive the events from the transferred monitors.
        • The client application must release the resources that were allocated for the original session.
        Parameters:
        request - a TransferMonitorObjects request that specifies the original and new session identifiers.
        Returns:
        TransferMonitorObjectsResponse
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • getDeviceIdList

        GetDeviceIdListResponse getDeviceIdList(GetDeviceIdList request)
                                 throws CstaException
        Gets the list of deviceIDs that are associated with the session specified in the request.

        The deviceIDs are returned in one or more GetDeviceIdListEvent messages that are sent after the GetDeviceIdListResponse.

        Parameters:
        request - a GetDeviceIdList request that specifies the optional session identifier to be queried. If not specified, the session on which the request was sent will be assumed. The user must own the specified session.
        Returns:
        GetDeviceIdListResponse
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • getMonitorList

        GetMonitorListResponse getMonitorList(GetMonitorList request)
                               throws CstaException
        Gets the list of deviceIDs and their established monitors, that are associated with the session specified in the request.

        The deviceIDs and their established monitors are returned in one or more GetMonitorListEvent messages that are sent after the GetMonitorListResponse.

        Parameters:
        request - a GetMonitorList request that specifies the optional session identifier to be queried. If not specified, the session on which the request was sent will be assumed. The user must own the specified session.
        Returns:
        GetMonitorListResponse
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
